segment.source: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions
segment.target: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions

segment.source: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions
segment.target: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions

segment.source: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions
segment.target: How to Manage User BitLocker Encryption Exemptions

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) enables you to exempt users from BitLocker Drive Encryption requirements.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) enables you to exempt users from BitLocker Drive Encryption requirements.

segment.source: To exempt users from BitLocker protection, you have to:
segment.target: To exempt users from BitLocker protection, you have to:

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Create an infrastructure to support exempted users.
segment.target: Create an infrastructure to support exempted users.

segment.source: Examples of this infrastructure include providing users with a contact telephone number, webpage, or mailing address that they can use to request an exemption.
segment.target: Examples of this infrastructure include providing users with a contact telephone number, webpage, or mailing address that they can use to request an exemption.

segment.source: Add the exempted user to a security group for a Group Policy Object that is configured specifically for exempted users.
segment.target: Add the exempted user to a security group for a Group Policy Object that is configured specifically for exempted users.

segment.source: When members of this security group sign in to a computer, the user’s Group Policy setting exempts the user from BitLocker protection.
segment.target: When members of this security group sign in to a computer, the user’s Group Policy setting exempts the user from BitLocker protection.

segment.source: The user’s Group Policy setting overwrites the computer policy, and the computer will remain exempt from BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: The user’s Group Policy setting overwrites the computer policy, and the computer will remain exempt from BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: MBAM does not enact the encryption policy if the computer is already BitLocker-protected and the user is exempted.
segment.target: MBAM does not enact the encryption policy if the computer is already BitLocker-protected and the user is exempted.

segment.source: However, if another user who is not exempt from the encryption policy signs in to the computer, encryption will take place.
segment.target: However, if another user who is not exempt from the encryption policy signs in to the computer, encryption will take place.

segment.source: The following steps describe what occurs when end users request an exemption from the BitLocker Drive Encryption exemption process through the MBAM Client or through whatever process your organization uses.
segment.target: The following steps describe what occurs when end users request an exemption from the BitLocker Drive Encryption exemption process through the MBAM Client or through whatever process your organization uses.

segment.source: You must configure MBAM Group Policy settings to allow end users to request an exemption from BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: You must configure MBAM Group Policy settings to allow end users to request an exemption from BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: When end users sign in to a computer that is required to be encrypted, they receive a notification that their computer is going to be encrypted.
segment.target: When end users sign in to a computer that is required to be encrypted, they receive a notification that their computer is going to be encrypted.

segment.source: They can select Request Exemption and postpone the encryption by selecting Postpone, or they can select Start Encryption to accept the BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: They can select Request Exemption and postpone the encryption by selecting Postpone, or they can select Start Encryption to accept the BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Selecting Request Exemption postpones the BitLocker protection until the maximum time that is set in the User Exemption Policy.
segment.target: Selecting Request Exemption postpones the BitLocker protection until the maximum time that is set in the User Exemption Policy.

segment.source: If end users select Request Exemption, they receive a notification telling them to contact the organization’s BitLocker administration group.
segment.target: If end users select Request Exemption, they receive a notification telling them to contact the organization’s BitLocker administration group.

segment.source: Depending on how the Configure User Exemption Policy is configured, users are provided with one or more of the following contact methods:
segment.target: Depending on how the Configure User Exemption Policy is configured, users are provided with one or more of the following contact methods:

segment.source: Phone number
segment.target: Phone number

segment.source: Webpage URL
segment.target: Webpage URL

segment.source: Mailing address
segment.target: Mailing address

segment.source: After the exemption request is received, the MBAM administrator decides whether to add the user to the BitLocker Exemption Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) group.
segment.target: After the exemption request is received, the MBAM administrator decides whether to add the user to the BitLocker Exemption Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) group.

segment.source: After an end user submits an exemption request, the MBAM Client reports the user as “Temporarily exempt.”
segment.target: After an end user submits an exemption request, the MBAM Client reports the user as “Temporarily exempt.”

segment.source: The Client then waits a specified number of days, which IT administrators configure, before it checks the computer’s compliance again.
segment.target: The Client then waits a specified number of days, which IT administrators configure, before it checks the computer’s compliance again.

segment.source: If the MBAM administrator rejects the exemption request, the exemption request option is deactivated, which prevents the user from requesting the exemption again.
segment.target: If the MBAM administrator rejects the exemption request, the exemption request option is deactivated, which prevents the user from requesting the exemption again.

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) enables you to exempt users from BitLocker Drive Encryption requirements.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) enables you to exempt users from BitLocker Drive Encryption requirements.

segment.source: To exempt users from BitLocker protection, you have to:
segment.target: To exempt users from BitLocker protection, you have to:

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Create an infrastructure to support exempted users.
segment.target: Create an infrastructure to support exempted users.

segment.source: Examples of this infrastructure include providing users with a contact telephone number, webpage, or mailing address that they can use to request an exemption.
segment.target: Examples of this infrastructure include providing users with a contact telephone number, webpage, or mailing address that they can use to request an exemption.

segment.source: Add the exempted user to a security group for a Group Policy Object that is configured specifically for exempted users.
segment.target: Add the exempted user to a security group for a Group Policy Object that is configured specifically for exempted users.

segment.source: When members of this security group sign in to a computer, the user’s Group Policy setting exempts the user from BitLocker protection.
segment.target: When members of this security group sign in to a computer, the user’s Group Policy setting exempts the user from BitLocker protection.

segment.source: The user’s Group Policy setting overwrites the computer policy, and the computer will remain exempt from BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: The user’s Group Policy setting overwrites the computer policy, and the computer will remain exempt from BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the computer is already BitLocker-protected, the User Exemption Policy has no effect.
segment.target: If the computer is already BitLocker-protected, the User Exemption Policy has no effect.

segment.source: In addition, if another user signs in to a computer that is not exempt from the encryption policy, encryption will take place.
segment.target: In addition, if another user signs in to a computer that is not exempt from the encryption policy, encryption will take place.

segment.source: The following steps describe what occurs when end users request an exemption from the BitLocker Drive Encryption exemption process through the MBAM Client or through whatever process your organization uses.
segment.target: The following steps describe what occurs when end users request an exemption from the BitLocker Drive Encryption exemption process through the MBAM Client or through whatever process your organization uses.

segment.source: You must configure MBAM Group Policy settings to allow end users to request an exemption from BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: You must configure MBAM Group Policy settings to allow end users to request an exemption from BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: When end users sign in to a computer that is required to be encrypted, they receive a notification that their computer is going to be encrypted.
segment.target: When end users sign in to a computer that is required to be encrypted, they receive a notification that their computer is going to be encrypted.

segment.source: They can select Request Exemption and postpone the encryption by selecting Postpone, or they can select Start Encryption to accept the BitLocker encryption.
segment.target: They can select Request Exemption and postpone the encryption by selecting Postpone, or they can select Start Encryption to accept the BitLocker encryption.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Selecting Request Exemption postpones the BitLocker protection until the maximum time that is set in the User Exemption Policy.
segment.target: Selecting Request Exemption postpones the BitLocker protection until the maximum time that is set in the User Exemption Policy.

segment.source: If end users select Request Exemption, they receive a notification telling them to contact the organization’s BitLocker administration group.
segment.target: If end users select Request Exemption, they receive a notification telling them to contact the organization’s BitLocker administration group.

segment.source: Depending on how the Configure User Exemption Policy is configured, users are provided with one or more of the following contact methods:
segment.target: Depending on how the Configure User Exemption Policy is configured, users are provided with one or more of the following contact methods:

segment.source: Phone number
segment.target: Phone number

segment.source: Webpage URL
segment.target: Webpage URL

segment.source: Mailing address
segment.target: Mailing address

segment.source: After the exemption request is received, the MBAM administrator decides whether to add the user to the BitLocker Exemption Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) group.
segment.target: After the exemption request is received, the MBAM administrator decides whether to add the user to the BitLocker Exemption Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) group.

segment.source: After an end user submits an exemption request, the MBAM Client reports the user as “Temporarily exempt.”
segment.target: After an end user submits an exemption request, the MBAM Client reports the user as “Temporarily exempt.”

segment.source: The Client then waits a specified number of days, which IT administrators configure, before it checks the computer’s compliance again.
segment.target: The Client then waits a specified number of days, which IT administrators configure, before it checks the computer’s compliance again.

segment.source: If the MBAM administrator rejects the exemption request, the exemption request option is deactivated, which prevents the user from requesting the exemption again.
segment.target: If the MBAM administrator rejects the exemption request, the exemption request option is deactivated, which prevents the user from requesting the exemption again.

segment.source: To exempt a user from BitLocker Drive Encryption
segment.target: To exempt a user from BitLocker Drive Encryption

segment.source: Create an AD DS security group that will be used to manage user exemptions from BitLocker encryption requirements.
segment.target: Create an AD DS security group that will be used to manage user exemptions from BitLocker encryption requirements.

segment.source: Create a Group Policy Object by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Group Policy Templates.
segment.target: Create a Group Policy Object by using the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Group Policy Templates.

segment.source: Associate the Group Policy Object with the AD DS group that you created in the previous step.
segment.target: Associate the Group Policy Object with the AD DS group that you created in the previous step.

segment.source: The policy settings to exempt users are located at: UserConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).
segment.target: The policy settings to exempt users are located at: UserConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).

segment.source: To the security group you created for BitLocker exempted users, add the names of the users who are requesting an exemption.
segment.target: To the security group you created for BitLocker exempted users, add the names of the users who are requesting an exemption.

segment.source: When a user signs in to a computer controlled by BitLocker, the MBAM Client checks the User Exemption Policy setting.
segment.target: When a user signs in to a computer controlled by BitLocker, the MBAM Client checks the User Exemption Policy setting.

segment.source: If the computer is already encrypted, BitLocker protection is not suspended.
segment.target: If the computer is already encrypted, BitLocker protection is not suspended.

segment.source: If the computer is not encrypted, MBAM does not prompt the user to encrypt.
segment.target: If the computer is not encrypted, MBAM does not prompt the user to encrypt.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Shared computer scenarios require special consideration when you are using BitLocker user exemptions.
segment.target: Shared computer scenarios require special consideration when you are using BitLocker user exemptions.

segment.source: If a non-exempt user signs in to a computer that is shared with an exempt user, the computer may be encrypted.
segment.target: If a non-exempt user signs in to a computer that is shared with an exempt user, the computer may be encrypted.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
